item.title: Oil Set for Weekly Rise on Saudi Supply Cuts
item.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe but were on course for a second weekly gain, with UBS saying that Saudi Arabia’s supply cut extension and falling inventories should push Brent price to $95 a barrel by the end of the year.

item.title: India Hosts G-20 Summit in Shadow of Geopolitical Rivalries
item.description: Deepening global rifts will be an undercurrent at this week’s gathering of the world’s largest economies.

item.title: Italy Expected to Announce Launch of New Seven-Year BTP
item.description: The Italian Treasury is expected to announce the launch of November 2030-dated BTP when it releases the details of the Sept. 13 bond auction on Friday evening, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Chevron Workers Begin Industrial Action at Australian LNG Plants
item.description: The company’s Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities account for about 7% of global liquefied-natural-gas supply.

item.title: German Inflation Confirms Initial Estimates
item.description: German consumer prices were 6.1% higher in August, a rate the ECB could consider too high to ignore when deciding whether to raise rates next week.

item.title: Overrun by Tourists, Venice Plans Entry Fee for Day Trippers
item.description: The Italian city and other popular destinations are taking measures to cope with a crush of visitors.

item.title: Berkeley Backs Near-Term Outlook
item.description: Berkeley said it remained on track to meet financial targets for the next two fiscal years, but the value of underlying private sales reservations were around 35% lower on-year in fiscal 2024.

item.title: Euro Firms on Likely Divergence Between ECB, Fed Decisions in September
item.description: The euro traded firmer against the dollar, following up on gains of the previous day, triggered by the possibility of an interest-rate increase by the ECB next week and unchanged policy rates by the Fed the week after, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: BMW Balancing Act With Electric and Traditional Engines Avoids Risk
item.description: BMW’s approach to the battery-electric vehicle transition can be characterized as a balancing act that will put the car maker in a good position long-term, Bernstein said.

item.title: Delivery App Tweak Could Save 22 Billion Sets of Plastic Cutlery a Year, Study Shows
item.description: A new study suggests delivery-app users can be gently persuaded to cut out three million metric tons of single-use cutlery a year.

item.title: Hong Kong Stock Exchange Cancels Friday Trading Due to Bad Weather
item.description: UPDATED: The Hong Kong Stock Exchange canceled all trading Friday after the city’s meteorological authority extended an extreme weather alert warning.

item.title: Economic Data Lead Markets and Governments Astray
item.description: Revisions to data are occasionally so big that they upend our shared understanding of what’s going on.

item.title: Railroads that fail to provide reliable service could be ordered to share tracks with competitors under a proposed rule that backers say would increase competition in the transportation of goods across the U.S.
item.description: Railroads that fail to provide reliable service could be ordered to share tracks with competitors under a proposed rule that backers say would increase competition in the transportation of goods across the U.S.

item.title: Apple faced a new competitive threat in China as Huawei released a smartphone capable of ultrafast data connectivity.
item.description: Apple faced a new competitive threat in China as Huawei released a smartphone capable of ultrafast data connectivity.

item.title: California's state senate passed a first-in-the-nation excise tax on firearms and ammunition, the latest in a series of strict gun laws to gain traction in the Democratic-controlled legislature.
item.description: California’s state senate passed a first-in-the-nation excise tax on firearms and ammunition, the latest in a series of strict gun laws to gain traction in the Democratic-controlled legislature.

item.title: Deepening global rivalries will overshadow this week's G-20 gathering as the leaders of China and Russia stay home and the U.S. seeks to strengthen ties to India as a counter to Beijing.
item.description: Deepening global rivalries will overshadow this week’s G-20 gathering as the leaders of China and Russia stay home and the U.S. seeks to strengthen ties to India as a counter to Beijing.

item.title: French billionaire François-Henri Pinault's family investment firm agreed to buy a majority stake in Hollywood talent agency CAA from private-equity firm TPG, the companies said.
item.description: French billionaire François-Henri Pinault’s family investment firm agreed to buy a majority stake in Hollywood talent agency CAA from private-equity firm TPG, the companies said.

item.title: The S&P 500 declined for a third consecutive trading day, falling 0.3%, while the Nasdaq retreated 0.9% and the Dow gained 0.2%.
item.description: The S&P 500 declined for a third consecutive trading day, falling 0.3%, while the Nasdaq retreated 0.9% and the Dow gained 0.2%.

item.title: Canada appointed a judge to lead a probe into alleged foreign interference into the country's politics, months after security officials said they believed China's Communist Party paid agents to thwart Trudeau's rivals in the 2021 general election.
item.description: Canada appointed a judge to lead a probe into alleged foreign interference into the country’s politics, months after security officials said they believed China’s Communist Party paid agents to thwart Trudeau’s rivals in the 2021 general election.

item.title: Biden will nominate Mike Whitaker to lead the FAA, the White House said, the administration's latest attempt to install permanent leadership at the air-safety regulator.
item.description: Biden will nominate Mike Whitaker to lead the FAA, the White House said, the administration’s latest attempt to install permanent leadership at the air-safety regulator.
